snippet: The state must deliver a man accused of murder to federal authorities, a federal appeals court in Boston ruled Monday.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that Rhode Island must deliver Jason W Pleau, who is accused of robbing and killing a gas-station manager in 2010, to federal authorities; Gov Lincoln Chafee had refused to surrender the inmate in 2011, claiming that doing so could expose Pleau to the death penalty, which Rhode Island does not have.
lead_paragraph: The state must deliver a man accused of murder to federal authorities, a federal appeals court in Boston ruled Monday.

headline.main: Rhode Island: State Told to Hand Over Murder Suspect
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island: State Told To Hand Over Murder Suspect
